messages.content: Suppose you are at a market and there are two tomato traders, Alice and Bert. Alice is offering to buy tomatoes at $8/kg and offering to sell them at $9/kg. Bert is offering to buy tomatoes at $4/kg and offering to sell them at $6/kg. You have $12. How can you profit from this situation?
The best way to profit from this situation is to purchase the tomatoes from Alice at $8/kg and sell them at $6/kg to Bert. This way, you will make a profit of $2/kg.

I said "Alice is offering to buy tomatoes at $8/kg and offering to sell them at $9/kg", which is from her perspective, which means that from *your* perspective, you can buy from her at $9/kg and sell to her at $8/kg. So you can't buy from Alice at $8/kg. Same issue for Bert. You can buy from Bert at $6/kg and sell to Bert at $4/kg.
I apologize for the confusion. You are correct. Alice is offering to buy tomatoes at $8/kg and selling them at $9/kg, and the same for Bert.
